channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What does ‘AI native’ even mean?
item.description: This week, news reports revealed that Meta would be cutting hundreds of jobs in its AI division. The layoffs will impact employees who work on AI prod...

item.title: Pentagon orders aircraft carrier to Latin America, boosting U.S. military buildup in the region to more than 10,000 sailors and Marines
item.description: The USS Gerald R. Ford, which has five destroyers in its strike group, is now deployed to the Mediterranean Sea.

item.title: Ontario quickly caves to Trump and promises to pull the offending Reagan ad that killed Canada trade talks
item.description: Days before he called the ad fraudulent, Trump told a group of Republican senators that he'd take out the same ad if he were Canadian.

item.title: There Are Lots of Ways to Raise Capital. Here’s How 3 Inc. 5000 Founders Did It
item.description: The founders of Bogg Bag, Culina Health, and Kona Ice spoke about growth capital at this week’s Inc. 5000 Conference.

item.title: Inflation Data Could Push Stocks to Record Highs
item.description: The S&P 500 has touched all-time highs following three of the past five CPI reports.

item.title: Toss these 3 Coca-Cola sodas right now—they could be contaminated with metal. Here’s which products to avoid
item.description: Three different Coca-Cola sodas are being recalled by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration as a result of the “potential presence of foreign material...

item.title: There Are 3 Types of Leaders, Says Jay Shetty, and Only 1 You Want to Be
item.description: The hit podcaster, who has interviewed Bill Gates, Ray Dalio, and Selena Gomez, shares what he’s learned about leadership.

item.title: Social Security payments will see these 3 changes in 2026: What to know about updates to benefits
item.description: The rules for collecting Social Security are changing in 2026. Two of the most important things to know if you’re collecting benefits: Your monthly ch...

item.title: Social Security payments to go up 2.8% next year while polls show three-fourths of seniors think 3% isn’t enough to keep up with rising prices
item.description: Recipients received a 2.5% cost-of-living boost in 2025 and a 3.2% increase in their benefits in 2024, after a historically large 8.7% benefit increas...

item.title: Stanford athlete turned wealth guru had everything he wanted by 30, but realized money doesn’t buy happiness: ‘I had the high-paying job, the title, the house, the car’
item.description: “The 5 Types of Wealth” author Sahil Bloom had all the trappings of success—but he quickly realized that money doesn’t buy happiness.

item.title: Here are over 20 kid tools for higher-quality screen time
item.description: This article is republished with permission from Wonder Tools , a newsletter that helps you discover the most useful sites and apps. Subscribe here . ...

item.title: AI ‘Consulting’ Services Can Help Smaller Businesses, but Risks Persist
item.description: As with anything related to AI-generated content, it’s important to keep a human in the loop before you act on any of its business advice.

item.title: Billionaire ex–Google CEO says one deceptively simple weekend habit will help you level up at work
item.description: It’s an approach he learned from his mentor, Silicon Valley legend Bill Campbell.

item.title: How a Free Service Helped This Company Reach $4 Million in Sales
item.description: When Abbode saw the demand for its in-house embroidery climb, founder Abigail Price decided to pull off a pivot.

item.title: What Hollywood’s next potential merger means for streaming
